metadata.synopsis: After a sheltered youth as the most bewitching -- but unattainable -- girl in her town, Ema Cardeano (Leonor Silveira) weds Carlo Paiva (Luís Miguel Cintra), a man twice her age. Ema enters into the marriage as a concession to familial and cultural expectations, and as a result she's forever ending up in the arms of other men. This provides her with fleeting moments of solace, but, in the end, her search for genuine happiness leaves her in a precarious position.

reviews: It's both elegant and subtle, a beautifully achieved pic that has a timeless poetical quality.

When others would be retiring, Oliveira gives us movie after movie that begs to be indulged, with great affection, as the autumnal output of a codger deserving of, if not destined for, a Lifetime Achievement Oscar.
Subtle, elegant, enigmatic, this movie by the veteran Oliveira exercises a powerful grip.
It mesmerizes, sometimes maddens and tests the emotional and physical reflexes.
This beautifully shot, slow-moving, talky meditation on a life of leisure led by an adulterous woman differs most radically from Flaubert's novel in its indifference to the middle class.
